member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.Tools.GetElapsedTimeSince1970
member.summary: Returns the number of seconds Given the name of a DLL and the name of a function, this function will load the DLL and get a pointer to the wanted function.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.Tools.GetFunctionPointer(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Given the name of a DLL and the name of a function, this function will load the DLL and get a pointer to the wanted function.

member.name: T:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler
member.summary: Provides mechanism for exception handling in wrapper. It handles both synchronous ans asynchronus error. To handle asynchronous error, you must register to client class to the MILExceptionhandler event

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler.MILExceptionHookHandlerFunction(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This method is being called when a MIL Exception occurs

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler.ExceptionHandlerTestCall(System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This method allow us to call the private method MILExceptionHandlerFunction. We need to call it in some unit tests and we use reflection to call it. We do not call directly MILExceptionHandlerFunction because for the parameter MIL_ID it throws an ArgumentException.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler.FireAsyncDelegate(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionInfo)
member.summary: Method called to fire the event of a MIL Asynchronous exception

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler.RegisterMILCall
member.summary: Method used to register a call so that when MIL reports an exception, we will be able to differentiate is the error was synchronous or asynchronous. If we omit to register the MIL calls we do, every MIL exception will then be treated as asynchronous exception.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILExceptionHandler.CheckForMILError(System.String)
member.summary: Method used when we called a MILFunction to check if there was an error during the call. This is to be used with synchronous MIL calls.

member.summary: Triangulate the 3D world coordinates of points from their pixel location in the image plane of two or more cameras.
member.param: Specifies the address of an array containing the identifiers of the camera calibration objects for each of the camera setups.
Specifies the address of the array containing the X-pixel coordinates of the common points in the image plane of each camera.
Specifies the address of the array containing the Y-pixel coordinates of the common points in the image plane of each camera. This array must have a size equal to (NbCalibrations x NbPoints).
Specifies the address of an array in which to write the calculated X-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the calculated Y-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the calculated Z-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the root mean square (RMS) error for the calculated world coordinates of each point.
Specifies the number of calibration objects. This should correspond to the number of cameras. This parameter must be greater or equal to 2.
Specifies the number of points to compute using triangulation. This parameter must be greater or equal to 1.
Specifies the world coordinate system that is common to all the specified camera calibration objects.

member.summary: Control a setting of a MIL timer and read the MIL timer.

member.returns: For M_TIMER_READ and M_TIMER_RESOLUTION , the returned value is cast to MIL_DOUBLE. For M_TIMER_RESET and M_TIMER_WAIT , this function returns 0.0.

member.summary: Control a bead context, the bead templates therein, or a bead result buffer.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the bead context or the bead result buffer to control.
Specifies the bead context, bead template (one or all), or bead result buffer to control.
Specifies the type of control to set.
Specifies the required value for the control.

member.summary: Draw specific features of a bead context or of a bead result.
member.param: Specifies the graphics context to use. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:

Specifies the bead context or result buffer for which to perform the drawing operation. The bead context or result buffer must have been previously allocated on the system using MbeadAlloc or MbeadAllocResult, respectively.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer in which to draw.
Specifies the type of operation to perform on the specified points.
Specifies the type of points for which the drawing operation will be performed.
Specifies the template (one or all) for which to perform the drawing operation, for either the bead context or bead result.

Specifies the trained point (one or all) for which to perform the drawing operation, or specifies that you are performing a general drawing operation for the templates in a context or a result buffer.
Specifies whether to use a distinct type of iconography to distinguish between templates and trained points that have passed and failed.

member.summary: Free a bead context or a bead result buffer.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MbeadVerify(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT)
member.summary: Verify beads according to the templates.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the bead context that contains the templates with which to validate the beads in the target image.

Specifies the identifier of the target image buffer that contains the beads that must be verified, according the templates contained within the bead context. The image buffer must be a 1-band 8-bit unsigned buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the bead result buffer in which to write the results of the verification.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MblobDraw(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT)
member.summary: Draw specific blob features in the destination image buffer.
member.param: Specifies the graphics context to use when drawing. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:
Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer from which to retrieve the features to draw.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer in which to draw. You can also choose to annotate an image non-destructively, by drawing into its display's overlay buffer.
Specifies the type of operation to perform.
Specifies the label of the blob or blobs to draw.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MblobFill(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT)
member.summary: Draw blobs that meet a specified fill criterion.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer.
Specifies which blobs to draw with the specified value.
Specifies the value with which to fill the blobs that meet the specified criterion. If the destination buffer is binary, this value must be 0 or 1.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MblobFree(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID)
member.summary: Free the blob analysis result buffer or the feature list.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer or feature list buffer to free. The buffer must have been successfully allocated, using MblobAllocResult or MblobAllocFeatureList , prior to calling this function.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MblobGetLabel(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT@)
member.summary: Get the label value of a blob at a specified position.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer where the labels are stored. Note, this function cannot obtain the label values of blobs that have been deleted from the result buffer with MblobSelect .
Specifies the X-coordinate of the blob.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the blob.

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the label value. If there is no blob at the specified location, the blob has been deleted, or if the blob's XPos and YPos lie outside the original identifier image, M_NULL is returned instead of the label value. Also, since MblobGetLabel returns the label value, you can set this parameter to M_NULL.
member.returns: The returned value is the label value of the specified blob.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MblobGetLabel(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.IntPtr)

Specifies the Y-coordinate of the blob.

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the label value. If there is no blob at the specified location, the blob has been deleted, or if the blob's XPos and YPos lie outside the original identifier image, M_NULL is returned instead of the label value. Also, since MblobGetLabel returns the label value, you can set this parameter to M_NULL.
member.returns: The returned value is the label value of the specified blob.

member.summary: Read the pixels along a specified arc and store their values in a user-defined array.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the source image buffer.
Specifies the X-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the radius along the X-axis. The radius should be given in pixels and must be greater than 0.
Specifies the radius along the Y-axis. The radius should be given in pixels and must be greater than 0.
Specifies the angle at which to start reading the arc, moving in a counter-clockwise direction. Express the angle in degrees relative to the positive X-axis.
Specifies the angle at which to stop reading the arc, moving in a counter-clockwise direction. Express the angle in degrees relative to the positive X-axis.
Specifies the address of the user array in which to store the pixels from the image buffer.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the number of pixels found along the arc.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MbufImport(System.String,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@)
member.summary: Import data from a file into a data buffer.
member.param: Specifies the name and path of the file from which to import the data.
Specifies the file format.
Specifies the import operation.
Specifies the system on which to allocate the buffer for an M_RESTORE operation. For an M_LOAD operation, this parameter should be set to M_NULL.

Specifies the address of the variable containing the buffer identifier, for an M_LOAD operation, or the address of the variable in which to store the new buffer identifier, for an M_RESTORE operation.
member.returns: The returned value is the buffer identifier (for an M_RESTORE operation only). If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MbufInquire(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Double@)
member.summary: Inquire about a MIL data buffer setting.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the source data buffer. The buffer must have been previously allocated on the required system using a function of the Buffer module (for example, MbufAllocColor or MbufImport ).
Specifies the type of buffer setting about which to inquire.
Specifies the address in which to write the requested information.
member.returns: The return value is the requested information, cast to a MIL_INT; otherwise M_ERROR is returned. For inquire types which specify that the UserVarPtr parameter must be set to the address of a MIL_INT64, the return value is M_NULL.

member.summary: Set the region of interest.

Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.
Specifies the type of operation to perform. This parameter must be set to one of the following:
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

Specifies the height of the source region.

Specifies the horizontal offset of the destination region, relative to the top-left coordinate of the destination buffer.

Specifies the width of the destination region.
Specifies the height of the destination region.

member.summary: Calibrate your camera setup using a grid.

Specifies the identifier of the image buffer containing the grid.

Specifies the X-position of the top-left circle of the calibration grid of circles or the top-left point connecting four squares in a chessboard gird. The offset is set in the calibration-plane coordinate system in world-units.

Specifies the Y-position of the top-left circle of the calibration grid of circles or the top-left point connecting four squares in a chessboard gird. The offset is set in the calibration-plane coordinate system in world-units.

Specifies the number of rows in the calibration grid.
Specifies the number of columns in the calibration grid.
Specifies the number of world units between rows.
Specifies the number of world units between columns.
Specifies the calibration operation to perform.
Specifies the type of grid used.

member.summary: Calibrate your camera setup using a list of coordinates.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the calibration object.
Specifies the address of the array containing the X-pixel coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array containing the Y-pixel coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array containing the X-world coordinates in the calibration-plane coordinate system.
Specifies the address of the array containing the Y-world coordinates in the calibration-plane coordinate system.
Specifies the address of the array containing the Z-world coordinates.

Specifies the number of coordinates in the supplied arrays. For a piecewise linear interpolation calibration mode, the minimum number of coordinates is 3. For a perspective transformation calibration mode, the minimum number of coordinates is 4. For a 3D-based calibration modes, the minimum number of coordinates is 6.
Specifies the calibration operation to perform.
Specifies the function's operation flag. This parameter must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.McodeModel(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@)
member.summary: Add, find, or delete a code model within a code context.
member.param: Specifies the code context in which to add, find, or delete the code model.
Specifies the operation to perform within the specified code context.
Specifies the code type of the code model to add or find from the code context. Note that if the Operation parameter is set to M_DELETE , set this parameter to M_NULL.
Specifies the instance of the code model to find in the context. Note that if the Operation parameter is set to M_ADD or M_DELETE , set this parameter to M_NULL.
Specifies the function's control flag. This parameter must be set to M_DEFAULT.
Specifies the address in which to return the code model identifier for M_ADD and M_FIND operations. For a M_DELETE operation, CodeModelIdPtr specifies the identifier of the model to be deleted.
member.returns: The returned value is the identifier of the code model for a successful M_ADD operation; if the model could not be added, M_NULL is returned. The returned value is the identifier of the code model for a successful M_FIND operation; M_NULL is returned if no code model is found. The returned value is M_NULL for an M_DELETE operation.

member.summary: Allocate a color matching context.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the color matching context.
Specifies the type of color context.

Specifies the context's color space. This is the color space in which the color data will be provided to McolDefine and McolMatch. It also defines the value returned by McolInquire with M_COLOR_SPACE.
Specifies the identifier of the context's reference color space. This is the standard used to interpret the color space data.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the color matching context identifier.
member.returns: The returned value is the color matching context's identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

Specifies the identifier of the source image buffer from which to define the color-sample. If you are defining a color-sample from three explicit color component values, or if you are deleting color-samples, set this parameter to M_NULL.

member.summary: Calculate the distance between colors.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the first source image buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the second source buffer, which can be either an image or an array.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer in which to write the results.
Specifies the identifier of the image buffer used to identify the masked (non-zero) pixels.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.
Specifies the type of distance operation to perform.

member.summary: Allocate an FPGA command context for a PU in the FPGA configuration loaded in a Processing FPGA on a target system.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MfuncAlloc(System.String,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MFUNCFCTPTR,System.String,System.String,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@)
member.summary: Allocate a MIL function context for your user-defined function.
member.param: Specifies the name of the user-defined function.
Specifies the number of parameters passed to the current user-defined function. Note that the number of parameters should not exceed 16.
Specifies the address of the slave function.
Specifies the name of the library file which contains the slave function's code.
Specifies the name of the slave function to export from the library file.

Allows you to assign an opcode to the slave function. The opcode will be used to locate the slave function when an application executes the user-defined MIL function. To specify an opcode, you must select a user module (see the table below), and combine it with an offset. For example, M_USER_MODULE_3+ 12.
Allows you to provide more information about the user-defined MIL function.

Specifies the address of the variable in which to store the MIL identifier provided for the user-defined function. Since the MfuncAlloc function also returns the MIL identifier, you can set this parameter to M_NULL.
member.returns: The returned value is the function context identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.param: Specifies the identifier of the graphics context. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:
Specifies the identifier of a valid image buffer in which to draw the rectangle or the identifier of a valid graphics list in which to add the rectangle.
Specifies the X-coordinate of the rectangle's position in the input coordinate system.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the rectangle's position in the input coordinate system.
Specifies the width of the rectangle, relative to the input coordinate system.
Specifies the height of the rectangle, relative to the input coordinate system.
Specifies the angle with which to rotate the rectangle, in degrees, relative to the input coordinate system.
Specifies how to draw the rectangle in the image or add the rectangle to the graphics list.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MimBinarize(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Perform a point-to-point binary threshold operation.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the data source of the operation.
Specifies the identifier of the destination of the results.
Specifies the condition, as well as the threshold mode to use to establish the threshold value(s) of the condition.
Specifies either the lower limit of the selected condition or the minimum value to use when establishing the threshold.
Specifies either the upper limit of the selected condition or the maximum value to use when establishing the threshold.
member.returns: When DestImageBufId is given an image buffer identifier, this function returns the specified value of the LowParam parameter. When DestImageBufId is set to M_NULL and the ConditionAndThreshMode parameter is set to one of the automatic threshold modes (M_BIMODAL, M_TRIANGLE_BISECTION_DARK, or M_TRIANGLE_BISECTION_BRIGHT), this function returns the automatically calculated threshold value. If the ConditionAndThreshMode parameter is set to M_PERCENTILE_VALUE, this function returns the threshold value established from the specified lower limit. When dealing with floating-point source buffers, the returned threshold is truncated to an integer value. Therefore, the returned threshold and the actual threshold used to binarize can differ.

Specifies the values to write to the destination buffer when a pixel satisfies the specified high clipping condition.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MimDeinterlace(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT)
member.summary: Produce a sequence of deinterlaced images from a sequence of images acquired from an interlaced camera.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the image processing context to be used for deinterlacing. The image processing context must have been previously allocated on the system using MimAlloc .

Specifies an array containing the identifiers of the buffers of the images to deinterlace. Only 8-bit and 16-bit buffers are supported. All source images must be of the same type, same format, and on the same system. Note that all source and destination images must have the same size.

Specifies an array containing the identifiers of the buffers of the images in which to save the deinterlaced images. Only 8-bit and 16-bit buffers are supported. All destination images must be of the same type, same format, and on the same system. Note that all source and destination images must have the same size.
Specifies the number of images in the source sequence.
Specifies the number of deinterlaced images in the destination sequence.
Reserved for future use. Should be set to M_DEFAULT.

member.summary: Get the calculated results or inquire the current values of a characteristic score mapping.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the measurement marker buffer.
Specifies the characteristic for which to get either the calculated results (M_RESULT) or the specified threshold values (M_MARKER).
Specifies the marker's index (for M_RESULT), or you must set this parameter to M_DEFAULT (for M_MARKER).

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write either the value of the calculated characteristic (for M_RESULT) or the minimum threshold that was specified for the characteristic (for M_MARKER).

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write either the characteristic score that was calculated (for M_RESULT) or the lower threshold that was specified for the characteristic (for M_MARKER).

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write either the value of the maximum allowable threshold that was calculated for the characteristic (for M_RESULT) or the higher threshold that was specified for the characteristic (for M_MARKER).
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the maximum threshold that was specified for the characteristic (for M_MARKER), or you must set this parameter to M_NULL (for M_RESULT).
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the score-offset that was specified for the characteristic (for M_MARKER), or you must set this parameter to M_NULL (for M_RESULT).
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the input units that were specified for the characteristic (for M_MARKER), or you must set this parameter to M_NULL (for M_RESULT).
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

member.summary: Allocate an OCR font context.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the OCR font context.
Specifies the OCR font context type and the type of its font.
Specifies how many characters can be stored in the OCR font context. The maximum number of characters supported is 500.
Specifies the width of the characters in the OCR font context, in pixels.
Specifies the height of the characters in the OCR font context, in pixels.
Specifies the distance between the edge of each character and their surrounding cell, along the X-axis, in pixels.
Specifies the distance between the edge of each character and their surrounding cell, along the Y-axis, in pixels.
Specifies the width of the characters without their surrounding cell, in pixels.
Specifies the height of the characters without their surrounding cell, in pixels.
Specifies the maximum thickness (stroke width) of the characters in the OCR font context, in pixels.
Specifies the maximum length of the string that can be read or verified using the OCR font context.
Specifies whether the characters are brighter than the background.
Specifies the address of the variable to which the OCR font context identifier is to be written.
member.returns: The returned value is the OCR font context identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.summary: Calibrate the OCR font context's character size, and target spacing to match the characters in a sample target image.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the sample target image buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the OCR font context to be calibrated.
Specifies the character string present in the sample target image. This string must be null-terminated.
Specifies the minimum width of the characters in the sample target image, in pixels.
Specifies the maximum width of the characters in the sample target image, in pixels.

Specifies the increment to use when searching for the character width between TargetCharSizeXMin and TargetCharSizeXMax . Note that very small step sizes should only be used within small ranges, otherwise application performance can be adversely affected.
Specifies the minimum height of the characters in the sample target image, in pixels.
Specifies the maximum height of the characters in the sample target image, in pixels.

Specifies the increment to use when searching for the character height between TargetCharSizeYMin and TargetCharSizeYMax . Note that very small step sizes should only be used within small ranges, otherwise application performance can be adversely affected.
Specifies the operation to be performed.

member.summary: Draw specific features of OCR fonts or OCR result occurrences in the destination image buffer.
member.param: Specifies the graphics context to use when drawing. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:

Specifies the OCR Font context or result buffer from which to extract the features to draw. or the OCR font context from which to retrieve the features to draw. The OCR Font context or result buffer must have been previously allocated using MocrAllocFont or MocrAllocResult .
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer in which to draw.
Specifies the type of operation to perform.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.
Specifies a string containing a list of valid characters to draw when drawing an OCR font. To draw all the characters in the font or to draw results, this parameter should be set to M_NULL.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer in which to draw.
Specifies the type of operation to perform.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.
Specifies a string containing a list of valid characters to draw when drawing an OCR font. To draw all the characters in the font or to draw results, this parameter should be set to M_NULL.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

Specifies the string(s) in the String Reader context to affect.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MstrStream(System.String,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,System.Double,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT@)
member.summary: Load, restore, or save a String Reader context from/to a file or a memory stream.
member.param: Specifies the file or memory stream.
Specifies the system on which to restore the String Reader context. For M_INQUIRE_SIZE_BYTE , M_LOAD , and M_SAVE , SystemId is ignored and should be set to M_NULL.
Specifies the operation to perform on the String Reader context.
Specifies the type of stream in which to store/from which to restore the String Reader context.
Specifies the MIL version of the String Reader context.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

member.summary: Perform a wait operation on a MIL thread or event.
member.param: Sets the identifier of the MIL thread context or event with which to be synchronized.
Specifies the wait option.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the state of the specified thread or event.
member.returns: The returned value for M_THREAD_END_WAIT , M_THREAD_WAIT , and M_EVENT_WAIT is M_EVENT_SET M_SIGNALED if the specified thread has successfully completed or if the state of the specified event has changed; it is M_TIMEOUT if the thread or event on which the current thread was waiting timed out. For M_EVENT_SYNCHRONIZE , the returned value is M_UNKNOWN.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL.MthrWaitMultiple(Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_ID@,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MIL_INT@)
member.summary: Perform a wait operation on multiple MIL events.
member.param: Specifies the address of a user-supplied array that contains the identifiers of the MIL events for which to wait.
Specifies the number of events in the user-supplied array.
Specifies the wait option.
Specifies the address in which to write the returned value.
member.returns: The returned value for M_EVENT_WAIT is the index of the event that changed to the M_EVENT_SET M_SIGNALED state, or M_TIMEOUT if none of the events in the array changed state before the time out interval is reached. For M_EVENT_WAIT + M_ALL_OBJECTS , the returned value is M_EVENT_SET M_SIGNALED if all the events specified in the array changed state, or M_TIMEOUT if the time out interval is reached before all the events in the array have changed state. For M_EVENT_SYNCHRONIZE , the returned value is M_UNKNOWN.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.M3dmapTriangulate(System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Triangulate the 3D world coordinates of points from their pixel location in the image plane of two or more cameras.
member.param: Specifies the address of an array containing the identifiers of the camera calibration objects for each of the camera setups.
Specifies the address of the array containing the X-pixel coordinates of the common points in the image plane of each camera.
Specifies the address of the array containing the Y-pixel coordinates of the common points in the image plane of each camera. This array must have a size equal to (NbCalibrations x NbPoints).
Specifies the address of an array in which to write the calculated X-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the calculated Y-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the calculated Z-world coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array in which to write the root mean square (RMS) error for the calculated world coordinates of each point.
Specifies the number of calibration objects. This should correspond to the number of cameras. This parameter must be greater or equal to 2.
Specifies the number of points to compute using triangulation. This parameter must be greater or equal to 1.
Specifies the world coordinate system that is common to all the specified camera calibration objects.

member.summary: Draw specific features of a bead context or of a bead result.
member.param: Specifies the graphics context to use. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:

Specifies the bead context or result buffer for which to perform the drawing operation. The bead context or result buffer must have been previously allocated on the system using MbeadAlloc or MbeadAllocResult, respectively.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer in which to draw.
Specifies the type of operation to perform on the specified points.
Specifies the type of points for which the drawing operation will be performed.
Specifies the template (one or all) for which to perform the drawing operation, for either the bead context or bead result.

Specifies the trained point (one or all) for which to perform the drawing operation, or specifies that you are performing a general drawing operation for the templates in a context or a result buffer.
Specifies whether to use a distinct type of iconography to distinguish between templates and trained points that have passed and failed.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbeadVerify(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Verify beads according to the templates.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the bead context that contains the templates with which to validate the beads in the target image.

Specifies the identifier of the target image buffer that contains the beads that must be verified, according the templates contained within the bead context. The image buffer must be a 1-band 8-bit unsigned buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the bead result buffer in which to write the results of the verification.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

Specifies the address of the variable in which the feature list identifier will be written.
member.returns: The returned value is the feature list identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobAllocResult(System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Allocate a blob analysis result buffer.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobCalculate(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform blob analysis calculations.
member.param: Specifies the blob identifier image that will be used in calculations.
Specifies the grayscale image (not a binary buffer) that will be used to calculate grayscale features.
Specifies the identifier of the feature list buffer, previously allocated with MblobAllocFeatureList , that specifies the feature(s) to calculate.
Specifies the identifier of a blob analysis result buffer, previously allocated with MblobAllocResult , in which to store calculated results.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobControl(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Control a blob analysis processing control setting.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer.
Specifies the processing setting to control.
Specifies the setting required for the control for the processing setting.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobDraw(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draw specific blob features in the destination image buffer.
member.param: Specifies the graphics context to use when drawing. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:
Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer from which to retrieve the features to draw.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer in which to draw. You can also choose to annotate an image non-destructively, by drawing into its display's overlay buffer.
Specifies the type of operation to perform.
Specifies the label of the blob or blobs to draw.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobFill(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draw blobs that meet a specified fill criterion.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer.
Specifies which blobs to draw with the specified value.
Specifies the value with which to fill the blobs that meet the specified criterion. If the destination buffer is binary, this value must be 0 or 1.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobFree(System.Int32)
member.summary: Free the blob analysis result buffer or the feature list.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer or feature list buffer to free. The buffer must have been successfully allocated, using MblobAllocResult or MblobAllocFeatureList , prior to calling this function.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobGetLabel(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get the label value of a blob at a specified position.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer where the labels are stored. Note, this function cannot obtain the label values of blobs that have been deleted from the result buffer with MblobSelect .
Specifies the X-coordinate of the blob.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the blob.

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the label value. If there is no blob at the specified location, the blob has been deleted, or if the blob's XPos and YPos lie outside the original identifier image, M_NULL is returned instead of the label value. Also, since MblobGetLabel returns the label value, you can set this parameter to M_NULL.
member.returns: The returned value is the label value of the specified blob.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobGetLabel(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get the label value of a blob at a specified position.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer where the labels are stored. Note, this function cannot obtain the label values of blobs that have been deleted from the result buffer with MblobSelect .
Specifies the X-coordinate of the blob.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the blob.

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the label value. If there is no blob at the specified location, the blob has been deleted, or if the blob's XPos and YPos lie outside the original identifier image, M_NULL is returned instead of the label value. Also, since MblobGetLabel returns the label value, you can set this parameter to M_NULL.
member.returns: The returned value is the label value of the specified blob.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobGetNumber(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get the number of currently included blobs.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the count. Since MblobGetNumber also returns the number of selected blobs, you can set this parameter to M_NULL.
member.returns: The returned value is the number of included blobs in the specified result buffer.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobGetNumber(System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Get the number of currently included blobs.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the count. Since MblobGetNumber also returns the number of selected blobs, you can set this parameter to M_NULL.
member.returns: The returned value is the number of included blobs in the specified result buffer.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MblobGetResult(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double@)
member.summary: Get results for a feature of the included blobs, from a blob result buffer.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the blob analysis result buffer from which to get results.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbufGetArc(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Single[],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Read the pixels along a specified arc and store their values in a user-defined array.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the source image buffer.
Specifies the X-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the Y-coordinate of the ellipse center, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the radius along the X-axis. The radius should be given in pixels and must be greater than 0.
Specifies the radius along the Y-axis. The radius should be given in pixels and must be greater than 0.
Specifies the angle at which to start reading the arc, moving in a counter-clockwise direction. Express the angle in degrees relative to the positive X-axis.
Specifies the angle at which to stop reading the arc, moving in a counter-clockwise direction. Express the angle in degrees relative to the positive X-axis.
Specifies the address of the user array in which to store the pixels from the image buffer.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the number of pixels found along the arc.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbufGetHookInfo(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double@)
member.summary: Get information about a hook event.
member.param: Specifies the buffer event identifier received by the hook-handler function (see MbufHookFunction ).
Specifies the event type and the type of information about the event to return.
Specifies the address in which to write the requested information.
member.returns: Returns null (M_NULL) on success, and returns a non-null (!M_NULL) value on failure, without logging any errors in the application.

member.summary: Read the pixels along a specified theoretical line, count the pixels, and store their values in a user-defined array.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the source image buffer.
Specifies the horizontal pixel offset of the starting position of the line, relative to the top-left pixel of the source buffer.
Specifies the vertical pixel offset of the starting position of the line, relative to the top-left pixel of the source buffer.
Specifies the horizontal pixel offset of the finishing position of the line, relative to the top-left pixel of the source buffer.
Specifies the vertical pixel offset of the finishing position of the line, relative to the top-left pixel of the source buffer.
Specifies the operation mode.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the number of pixels found along the theoretical line.
Specifies the address of the user array in which to store the pixels from the image buffer.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbufImport(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Import data from a file into a data buffer.
member.param: Specifies the name and path of the file from which to import the data.
Specifies the file format.
Specifies the import operation.
Specifies the system on which to allocate the buffer for an M_RESTORE operation. For an M_LOAD operation, this parameter should be set to M_NULL.

Specifies the address of the variable containing the buffer identifier, for an M_LOAD operation, or the address of the variable in which to store the new buffer identifier, for an M_RESTORE operation.
member.returns: The returned value is the buffer identifier (for an M_RESTORE operation only). If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbufInquire(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double@)
member.summary: Inquire about a MIL data buffer setting.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the source data buffer. The buffer must have been previously allocated on the required system using a function of the Buffer module (for example, MbufAllocColor or MbufImport ).
Specifies the type of buffer setting about which to inquire.
Specifies the address in which to write the requested information.
member.returns: The return value is the requested information, cast to a MIL_INT; otherwise M_ERROR is returned. For inquire types which specify that the UserVarPtr parameter must be set to the address of a MIL_INT64, the return value is M_NULL.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbufSetRegion(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the region of interest.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the image buffer in which the region is set. Once the region of interest is defined, any further processing will only consider the image pixels that are part of the region data stored in the buffer.

Specifies the identifier that contains the data of the region to set. The data can be in the form of an image mask or a graphics list, and is copied into the region storage of the image buffer. Must be set to M_NULL to set back the processing region to be the whole image.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.
Specifies the type of operation to perform. This parameter must be set to one of the following:
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MbufTransfer(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Copy a two-dimensional region of one or all bands from the source buffer into a two-dimensional region of one or all bands in the destination buffer, using a specified transfer function and transfer type.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the source buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the destination buffer.
Specifies the horizontal offset of the source region, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the vertical offset of the source region, relative to the top-left coordinate of the source buffer.
Specifies the width of the source region.
Specifies the height of the source region.
Specifies the color band of the region from which to copy. This parameter can be set to one of the following values:
Specifies the horizontal offset of the destination region, relative to the top-left coordinate of the destination buffer.
Specifies the vertical offset of the destination region, relative to the top-left coordinate of the destination buffer.
Specifies the width of the destination region.
Specifies the height of the destination region.
Specifies the color band of the destination region in which to copy.
Specifies the function to use in the transfer. This parameter can be set to one of the following:
Specifies the type of transfer.
Specifies the value that is passed to the transfer function.
Specifies a pointer to the MIL identifier of the overlay buffer, if applicable.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McalAlloc(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allocate a calibration object or a fixturing offset object.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the calibration object.
Specifies the calibration mode, if allocating a calibration object. Otherwise, specifies to allocate a fixturing offset.
Specifies the function's operation flag.
Specifies the address in which to return the identifier of the calibration object or fixturing offset object. Since McalAlloc also returns the identifier, you can set this parameter to M_NULL.
member.returns: The returned value is the calibration or fixturing offset object identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McalAlloc(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Allocate a calibration object or a fixturing offset object.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the calibration object.
Specifies the calibration mode, if allocating a calibration object. Otherwise, specifies to allocate a fixturing offset.
Specifies the function's operation flag.
Specifies the address in which to return the identifier of the calibration object or fixturing offset object. Since McalAlloc also returns the identifier, you can set this parameter to M_NULL.
member.returns: The returned value is the calibration or fixturing offset object identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McalAssociate(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Associate/disassociate a calibration object to/from an image or digitizer.
member.param: Specifies the calibration object to associate. This parameter can be set to one of the following. If an image buffer, digitizer or result buffer is passed to this parameter, the calibration object associated with that object is used; calibration settings saved with the image, digitizer or result are also copied.
Specifies the identifier of the image or digitizer with which to associate the calibration object.
Specifies the function's control flag.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McalControl(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Control a calibration object parameter setting.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the calibration object or calibrated image.
Specifies the setting to change.
Specifies the setting's new value.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McalDraw(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draw specific features of results obtained from a calibration operation.
member.param: Specifies the graphics context to use when drawing.
Specifies the calibration object or calibrated image from which to extract the calibration information to draw.
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer in which to draw. This buffer must be an unsigned 8-bit image buffer.
Specifies the type of operation to perform.
Specifies the index of the pose of a M_3D_ROBOTICS calibration object from which the calibration points should be drawn.
Specifies the function's control flag and should be set to M_DEFAULT.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McalFixture(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Move the relative coordinate system or learn the fixturing offset.

member.summary: Calibrate your camera setup using a grid.

Specifies the identifier of the image buffer containing the grid.

Specifies the X-position of the top-left circle of the calibration grid of circles or the top-left point connecting four squares in a chessboard gird. The offset is set in the calibration-plane coordinate system in world-units.

Specifies the Y-position of the top-left circle of the calibration grid of circles or the top-left point connecting four squares in a chessboard gird. The offset is set in the calibration-plane coordinate system in world-units.

Specifies the number of rows in the calibration grid.
Specifies the number of columns in the calibration grid.
Specifies the number of world units between rows.
Specifies the number of world units between columns.
Specifies the calibration operation to perform.
Specifies the type of grid used.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McalList(System.Int32,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calibrate your camera setup using a list of coordinates.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the calibration object.
Specifies the address of the array containing the X-pixel coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array containing the Y-pixel coordinates.
Specifies the address of the array containing the X-world coordinates in the calibration-plane coordinate system.
Specifies the address of the array containing the Y-world coordinates in the calibration-plane coordinate system.
Specifies the address of the array containing the Z-world coordinates.

Specifies the number of coordinates in the supplied arrays. For a piecewise linear interpolation calibration mode, the minimum number of coordinates is 3. For a perspective transformation calibration mode, the minimum number of coordinates is 4. For a 3D-based calibration modes, the minimum number of coordinates is 6.
Specifies the calibration operation to perform.
Specifies the function's operation flag. This parameter must be set to M_DEFAULT .

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McalRelativeOrigin(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Change the origin and/or orientation of the relative coordinate system.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the calibration object or calibrated image.
Specifies the X-offset of the relative coordinate system origin from the reference coordinate system, in world-units.
Specifies the Y-offset of the relative coordinate system origin from the reference coordinate system, in world-units.
Specifies the Z-offset of the relative coordinate system origin from the reference coordinate system, in world-units.

Specifies the angle, in degrees, at which to orient the relative coordinate system with respect to the reference coordinate system. A positive angle will rotate the relative coordinate system counterclockwise, that is, in the direction from the positive X-axis to the negative Y-axis.
Specifies how to apply the transformation. This parameter establishes the reference coordinate system.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McalTransformCoordinate3dList(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Convert three-dimensional coordinates between two coordinate systems.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McodeModel(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Add, find, or delete a code model within a code context.
member.param: Specifies the code context in which to add, find, or delete the code model.
Specifies the operation to perform within the specified code context.
Specifies the code type of the code model to add or find from the code context. Note that if the Operation parameter is set to M_DELETE , set this parameter to M_NULL.
Specifies the instance of the code model to find in the context. Note that if the Operation parameter is set to M_ADD or M_DELETE , set this parameter to M_NULL.
Specifies the function's control flag. This parameter must be set to M_DEFAULT.
Specifies the address in which to return the code model identifier for M_ADD and M_FIND operations. For a M_DELETE operation, CodeModelIdPtr specifies the identifier of the model to be deleted.
member.returns: The returned value is the identifier of the code model for a successful M_ADD operation; if the model could not be added, M_NULL is returned. The returned value is the identifier of the code model for a successful M_FIND operation; M_NULL is returned if no code model is found. The returned value is M_NULL for an M_DELETE operation.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.McolAlloc(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allocate a color matching context.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the color matching context.
Specifies the type of color context.

Specifies the context's color space. This is the color space in which the color data will be provided to McolDefine and McolMatch. It also defines the value returned by McolInquire with M_COLOR_SPACE.
Specifies the identifier of the context's reference color space. This is the standard used to interpret the color space data.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the color matching context identifier.
member.returns: The returned value is the color matching context's identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MedgeSave(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Save an Edge Finder context to a file, or save edge chains and/or edge approximations from an Edge Finder result buffer to a CAD (Computer-Aided Design) file.
member.param: Specifies the name and path of the file in which to save the Edge Finder context, or the destination CAD file.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MfuncAlloc(System.String,System.Int32,Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MFUNCFCTPTR,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allocate a MIL function context for your user-defined function.
member.param: Specifies the name of the user-defined function.
Specifies the number of parameters passed to the current user-defined function. Note that the number of parameters should not exceed 16.
Specifies the address of the slave function.
Specifies the name of the library file which contains the slave function's code.
Specifies the name of the slave function to export from the library file.

Allows you to assign an opcode to the slave function. The opcode will be used to locate the slave function when an application executes the user-defined MIL function. To specify an opcode, you must select a user module (see the table below), and combine it with an offset. For example, M_USER_MODULE_3+ 12.
Allows you to provide more information about the user-defined MIL function.

Specifies the address of the variable in which to store the MIL identifier provided for the user-defined function. Since the MfuncAlloc function also returns the MIL identifier, you can set this parameter to M_NULL.
member.returns: The returned value is the function context identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MimBinarize(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Perform a point-to-point binary threshold operation.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the data source of the operation.
Specifies the identifier of the destination of the results.
Specifies the condition, as well as the threshold mode to use to establish the threshold value(s) of the condition.
Specifies either the lower limit of the selected condition or the minimum value to use when establishing the threshold.
Specifies either the upper limit of the selected condition or the maximum value to use when establishing the threshold.
member.returns: When DestImageBufId is given an image buffer identifier, this function returns the specified value of the LowParam parameter. When DestImageBufId is set to M_NULL and the ConditionAndThreshMode parameter is set to one of the automatic threshold modes (M_BIMODAL, M_TRIANGLE_BISECTION_DARK, or M_TRIANGLE_BISECTION_BRIGHT), this function returns the automatically calculated threshold value. If the ConditionAndThreshMode parameter is set to M_PERCENTILE_VALUE, this function returns the threshold value established from the specified lower limit. When dealing with floating-point source buffers, the returned threshold is truncated to an integer value. Therefore, the returned threshold and the actual threshold used to binarize can differ.

Specifies an array containing the identifiers of the buffers of the images to deinterlace. Only 8-bit and 16-bit buffers are supported. All source images must be of the same type, same format, and on the same system. Note that all source and destination images must have the same size.

Specifies an array containing the identifiers of the buffers of the images in which to save the deinterlaced images. Only 8-bit and 16-bit buffers are supported. All destination images must be of the same type, same format, and on the same system. Note that all source and destination images must have the same size.
Specifies the number of images in the source sequence.
Specifies the number of deinterlaced images in the destination sequence.
Reserved for future use. Should be set to M_DEFAULT.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MmeasGetScore(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the calculated results or inquire the current values of a characteristic score mapping.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the measurement marker buffer.
Specifies the characteristic for which to get either the calculated results (M_RESULT) or the specified threshold values (M_MARKER).
Specifies the marker's index (for M_RESULT), or you must set this parameter to M_DEFAULT (for M_MARKER).

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write either the value of the calculated characteristic (for M_RESULT) or the minimum threshold that was specified for the characteristic (for M_MARKER).

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write either the characteristic score that was calculated (for M_RESULT) or the lower threshold that was specified for the characteristic (for M_MARKER).

Specifies the address of the variable in which to write either the value of the maximum allowable threshold that was calculated for the characteristic (for M_RESULT) or the higher threshold that was specified for the characteristic (for M_MARKER).
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the maximum threshold that was specified for the characteristic (for M_MARKER), or you must set this parameter to M_NULL (for M_RESULT).
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the score-offset that was specified for the characteristic (for M_MARKER), or you must set this parameter to M_NULL (for M_RESULT).
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the input units that were specified for the characteristic (for M_MARKER), or you must set this parameter to M_NULL (for M_RESULT).
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MmodStream(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Load, restore, or save a Model Finder context from/to a file or a memory stream.
member.param: Specifies the file or memory stream.
Specifies the system on which to restore the Model Finder context. For M_INQUIRE_SIZE_BYTE , M_LOAD , and M_SAVE , SystemId is ignored and should be set to M_NULL.
Specifies the operation to perform on the Model Finder context.
Specifies the type of stream in which to store/from which to restore the Model Finder context.
Specifies the MIL version of the Model Finder context.

Specifies whether to restore, from the file or memory stream, the calibration objects associated to the models, or specifies to save, with the Model Finder context, the calibration objects associated to the models.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write or from which to read the identifier of the Model Finder context.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the size of the Model Finder context, in bytes.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MocrAllocFont(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allocate an OCR font context.
member.param: Specifies the system on which to allocate the OCR font context.
Specifies the OCR font context type and the type of its font.
Specifies how many characters can be stored in the OCR font context. The maximum number of characters supported is 500.
Specifies the width of the characters in the OCR font context, in pixels.
Specifies the height of the characters in the OCR font context, in pixels.
Specifies the distance between the edge of each character and their surrounding cell, along the X-axis, in pixels.
Specifies the distance between the edge of each character and their surrounding cell, along the Y-axis, in pixels.
Specifies the width of the characters without their surrounding cell, in pixels.
Specifies the height of the characters without their surrounding cell, in pixels.
Specifies the maximum thickness (stroke width) of the characters in the OCR font context, in pixels.
Specifies the maximum length of the string that can be read or verified using the OCR font context.
Specifies whether the characters are brighter than the background.
Specifies the address of the variable to which the OCR font context identifier is to be written.
member.returns: The returned value is the OCR font context identifier if the allocation is successful. If allocation fails, M_NULL is returned.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MocrCalibrateFont(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calibrate the OCR font context's character size, and target spacing to match the characters in a sample target image.
member.param: Specifies the identifier of the sample target image buffer.
Specifies the identifier of the OCR font context to be calibrated.
Specifies the character string present in the sample target image. This string must be null-terminated.
Specifies the minimum width of the characters in the sample target image, in pixels.
Specifies the maximum width of the characters in the sample target image, in pixels.

Specifies the increment to use when searching for the character width between TargetCharSizeXMin and TargetCharSizeXMax . Note that very small step sizes should only be used within small ranges, otherwise application performance can be adversely affected.
Specifies the minimum height of the characters in the sample target image, in pixels.
Specifies the maximum height of the characters in the sample target image, in pixels.

Specifies the increment to use when searching for the character height between TargetCharSizeYMin and TargetCharSizeYMax . Note that very small step sizes should only be used within small ranges, otherwise application performance can be adversely affected.
Specifies the operation to be performed.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MocrDraw(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draw specific features of OCR fonts or OCR result occurrences in the destination image buffer.
member.param: Specifies the graphics context to use when drawing. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:

Specifies the OCR Font context or result buffer from which to extract the features to draw. or the OCR font context from which to retrieve the features to draw. The OCR Font context or result buffer must have been previously allocated using MocrAllocFont or MocrAllocResult .
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer in which to draw.
Specifies the type of operation to perform.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.
Specifies a string containing a list of valid characters to draw when drawing an OCR font. To draw all the characters in the font or to draw results, this parameter should be set to M_NULL.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MocrDraw(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draw specific features of OCR fonts or OCR result occurrences in the destination image buffer.
member.param: Specifies the graphics context to use when drawing. This parameter must be set to one of the following values:

Specifies the OCR Font context or result buffer from which to extract the features to draw. or the OCR font context from which to retrieve the features to draw. The OCR Font context or result buffer must have been previously allocated using MocrAllocFont or MocrAllocResult .
Specifies the identifier of the destination image buffer in which to draw.
Specifies the type of operation to perform.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.
Specifies a string containing a list of valid characters to draw when drawing an OCR font. To draw all the characters in the font or to draw results, this parameter should be set to M_NULL.
Reserved for future expansion and must be set to M_DEFAULT.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MthrWait(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Perform a wait operation on a MIL thread or event.
member.param: Sets the identifier of the MIL thread context or event with which to be synchronized.
Specifies the wait option.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the state of the specified thread or event.
member.returns: The returned value for M_THREAD_END_WAIT , M_THREAD_WAIT , and M_EVENT_WAIT is M_EVENT_SET M_SIGNALED if the specified thread has successfully completed or if the state of the specified event has changed; it is M_TIMEOUT if the thread or event on which the current thread was waiting timed out. For M_EVENT_SYNCHRONIZE , the returned value is M_UNKNOWN.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MthrWait(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Perform a wait operation on a MIL thread or event.
member.param: Sets the identifier of the MIL thread context or event with which to be synchronized.
Specifies the wait option.
Specifies the address of the variable in which to write the state of the specified thread or event.
member.returns: The returned value for M_THREAD_END_WAIT , M_THREAD_WAIT , and M_EVENT_WAIT is M_EVENT_SET M_SIGNALED if the specified thread has successfully completed or if the state of the specified event has changed; it is M_TIMEOUT if the thread or event on which the current thread was waiting timed out. For M_EVENT_SYNCHRONIZE , the returned value is M_UNKNOWN.

member.name: M:Matrox.MatroxImagingLibrary.MILRaw.MthrWaitMultiple(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Perform a wait operation on multiple MIL events.
member.param: Specifies the address of a user-supplied array that contains the identifiers of the MIL events for which to wait.
Specifies the number of events in the user-supplied array.
Specifies the wait option.
Specifies the address in which to write the returned value.
member.returns: The returned value for M_EVENT_WAIT is the index of the event that changed to the M_EVENT_SET M_SIGNALED state, or M_TIMEOUT if none of the events in the array changed state before the time out interval is reached. For M_EVENT_WAIT + M_ALL_OBJECTS , the returned value is M_EVENT_SET M_SIGNALED if all the events specified in the array changed state, or M_TIMEOUT if the time out interval is reached before all the events in the array have changed state. For M_EVENT_SYNCHRONIZE , the returned value is M_UNKNOWN.
